meanings.sent1: Yesterday, I sold my old bike for some extra cash.
meanings.sent2: She sold her handmade jewelry at the craft fair.
meanings.sent3: The cat sold its owner out by meowing loudly when they were trying to hide.
meanings.sent4: His convincing arguments sold me on the idea of going on a road trip.
meanings.sent5: The enthusiastic salesman sold the vacuum cleaner with great flair.

meanings.definition: having been exchanged for money or goods
meanings.sent1: The sold car was in great condition for its age.
meanings.sent2: The sold-out concert left many fans disappointed.
meanings.sent3: The sold shirt had a unique design that caught everyone's attention.
meanings.sent4: Her sold phone was a bargain compared to the brand new models.
meanings.sent5: The sold painting fetched a high price at the auction.

meanings.sent1: The company sold all its old inventory to make room for new products.
meanings.sent2: They sold their old house to move into a bigger one.
meanings.sent3: The magician sold his tricks to the highest bidder.
meanings.sent4: She sold her collection of stamps to a passionate collector.
meanings.sent5: The farmer sold his crops at the market every weekend.
